medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain in bilateral lower quadrants with associated nausea, vomiting, fevers, and chills.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 24 hours prior to admission, characterized by pain in the bilateral lower quadrants, nausea, vomiting, fevers, and chills. The intensity and progression of pain, along with the other symptoms, indicate a serious abdominal issue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes Mellitus, Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Hypothyroidism, HSV1, Diverticulitis, Atrial Tachycardia, Past surgical history includes a thyroidectomy.
